title: Flat Eric Portrait
description: Isn't he the greatest? I got together with Flat and shot this for the new website he's making. www.flat-eric.com/ He was a pleasure to work with, and an all around great puppet.

title: Porst SP Xpro Puppet Parade 7
description:
LA's largest puppet parade ever, along the Third Street Promenade in Santa Monica, April 2013.

The parade concluded the L.A. Puppet Fest, a month-long puppet festival that included performances, films, workshops and exhibits around the city.

Puppets can also be donated to the Puppets for Peace Drive, which aims to promote peace through puppetry. The drive is now collecting puppets to send to the school attended by 8-year-old Martin Richard, who died in the Boston Marathon bombings.
-Santa Monica Patch

Porst Compact Reflex SP with the SMC Takumar 150mm f/4 lens on cross-processed Kodak Elite Chrome slide film.

title: Keepin' it Real
description: on stage... Scooter is a TED Speaker. “On behalf of puppets and puppet governments everywhere…” he opened, and then called TED2012 the “Academy Awards for nerds” (perhaps not knowing that the very next speaker would embrace that epithet in her opening slide). Scooter's TED Talk title: “Can Tactile Icons Survive in an Integer-Driven Environment?” In other words, Muppets vs. CGI. Or “Formulas vs. Felt.” What are some of the spurious claims about computer-generated characters surpassing puppets: - "CG can do 3D? Well, Muppets have always been 3D. Yup. And real time.” - "CG can do motion capture? This is simple. Hand moves, puppet moves. Motion captured.” - "Artificial intelligence? Artificial? In all the years I’ve been with the Muppets, we never had to do anything intelligent, artificial or otherwise.”
